title: David Geffen School of Medicine: Latest News & Videos, Photos about David Geffen School of Medicine | The Economic Times - Page 1
description: David Geffen School of Medicine Latest Breaking News, Pictures, Videos, and Special Reports from The Economic Times. David Geffen School of Medicine Blogs, Comments and Archive News on Economictimes.com
cleaned_text: Medicine SEARCHED FOR: DAVID GEFFEN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE Can AI invent? The philosophical debate that can shape the future of innovation Experts are debating the legal status of AI-generated inventions, and whether they warrant patent protection. While some argue that only humans can invent, others say that generative AI is a new breed of computer program that produces unscripted results. Decide whether AI system can be a patent 'inventor': Experts Seeks answers as AI stands on brink of invading another human venture Enthusiasts fight uphill battle to prove AI can be an inventor The role, and legal status, of AI in invention also have implications for the future path of innovation and global competitiveness, experts say. Want to get rid of bowel problems? Follow the low-FODMAP diet FODMAPs are certain types - called fermentable oligosaccharides, disaccharides, monosaccharides and polyols, as the acronym suggests - that often can't be fully digested or absorbed in the small intestine and are instead fermented by microbes in the colon. This can cause gastrointestinal distress. Why do women start gaining belly fat in their 40s? In the years levels of hormones like estrogen shift, and research suggests that these shifts may lead to changes in body shape. Research shows that Covid antibodies fade rapidly, raising risk of lost immunity The correspondence in the New England Journal of Medicine outlined research on antibodies taken from the blood of 34 patients who had recovered after suffering mainly mild symptoms that didn't require intensive care. [Go To Page 1](#1) Don't let coronavirus anxiety take over: Harvard Medical School recommends yoga, meditationAasana, Dhyana and Praanayama could go a long way in mitigating isolation anxiety. Harvard Medical School recommends yoga, meditation to deal with coronavirus anxietyThe Harvard Medical School said in its latest health guideline that, yoga, meditation and controlled breathing are "some tried and true ways to relax". The article 'Coping with coronavirus anxiety' was published this week. How brain zapping could decrease psychiatric symptomsNew York, Oct 4 (IANS) Electrifying brain circuits could treat neurological and psychiatric symptoms not because it causes neurons to fire but it creates an environment that makes it more or less likely for neurons to fire, researchers, including one of Indian-origin, have found. Can your vet heal you too?Oncology is probably the field which has already benefitted the most from collaborations between human and veterinary medicine.
